intro: Huberia souza-limae, commonly known as the São Paulo nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom at night. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a slightly hairy texture. Huberia souza-limae is often found in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome.
